runs.comm: steams in, hits the pitch hard back of a length, Dunk blocks safely from the crease
gets on top of the bounce and drives firmly, picks out mid-off
excellent bumper from Abbott, only slightly short but it rears at Dunk, who dunks his head down out of the line
length delivery, this is a little wide but Dunk misses out, flails around the delivery as it flies through
overpitched, in the channel, connects this time and drills three through cover point, opened the face nicely
length ball, skids on a touch and nearly catches out Finch, who turns the ball softly to leg
good length and a teasing line outside off, crackles to life off the pitch and flies through to the keeper - excellent start
fuller and straighter, tapped back to the bowler
flashed and flashed hard, over the leap of Behardien at cover-point, given a bit of width and Dunk thrashed a short ball over the infield
too full this time and rasped down the ground, lovely shape on the drive and that's four more
good length, 141 clicks and it squirts off the outside edge as Dunk pushes forwards, single to third man
slides down the leg side - 145kph, fast but wayward
banged in very short, veering towards the leg side again, Finch offers nothing and Rabada gets away with it
Dunk skips out on the attack, gets the toe end of the bat but manages to lift it through the covers for three more
back of a length and sprayed down the leg side - SA have already given up more extras than Australia
stays back in the crease and pats a shortish ball towards mid-on
that's meat and drink for Finch, short and clubbed powerfully through backward square for his first boundary
Abbott feeds the beats again, half-track at the body and Finch muscles it away to the same part of the ground for another four
redirects his line, short of a length in the channel, punched into a gap at cover, through Parnell fields well to keep them to a single
angled across the lefty, opens the face and squirts one through the gully
length ball on off stump, Dunk reaches out and pushes into the covers
ooh, lovely delivery, tossed up and dipping as Dunk tries to work to leg, spins past the outside edge
uses the feet, full ball drifting towards leg stump, clubs one to long-on
oof, not so good, low full toss to Finch who bludgeons it to wide long-on in the manner of a man chopping down a tree
flatter, on the stumps, crunched back down the ground again, not the cleanest strike but it beats a rather feeble effort from long-on running across
flat again, straightening on the stumps, Finch backs away and chops into the off side
shortish and Dunk miscues a pull along the ground to midwicket
bit of width, slashed and top-edged beyond the grasp of slip... it was a front-foot no-ball too. Never mind the wheels coming off, the axle is broken too
free hit for Dunk but it's well bowled by Parnell, right up on his toes and squeezed to mid-off
whips this away through the leg side for a couple

makes room to swing down the ground but Dunk has picked out mid-on! Parnell bellows out a celebration, maybe hurried the batsman a little or could have been a cutter, he backed away and clubbed it straight into Abbott's bread basker. Dunk is back in the slammer after an enterprising knock
angled across from over the wicket, drops back and runs the ball behind square to get off the mark first ball
tight line, Finch covers his stumps in defence
spiders to the crease, fullish on leg stump, clipped straight to midwicket along the ground
floated up outside leg stump, Watto sweeps and misses and de Kock whips off the bails... Wide
flat trajectory on middle and leg, punched down the ground to long-on
full and straight and dealt with dismissively, Finch swivelling his bulk through a flat sweep to fine leg
four more, bullied through midwicket this time, played with the turn for the googly and smashed it past the man in the deep
on the stumps, worked to midwicket, can't get it through
skids on and tapped back to the on side
short and wide and slapped through backward point for another boundary. South Africa are on the rocks, holed below the waterline
pitched up, better line, Watson leans into a push
punishing cover drive from Watto! He loves that shot, plants the front foot and brutalises a slightly full ball through the off side
another boundary, Watto's rolling out the wagon wheel, feeble bouncer from McLaren and this is whipped through deep midwicket

superb stroke, wattage from Watto, not a particularly bad ball this time but Watson had his weight back, rolled the arms through a beefy whack to the leg side, beats the fielder at deep square leg even though it was just a few yards to his left
line and length, this time Watson respectfully defends back to the bowler
regulation legspinner from Tahir, bit of width and Finch slices a drives short of point, only half fielded
tossed up, Watson comes forward and spears one more to long-on
gets down to sweep and the ball spins away from Rabada, who looks a bit dozy as he grabs thin air and the ball goes for four
slightly wide and there's an anguished cry from the bowler as Finch chops one more in front of square
mistimes a push back down the pitch
tossed up, Watson isn't to the pitch and he top-edges an ungainly hoick... but it sails beyond the circle safely towards deep cover
short of a length, muscled on the pull into the deep and it's not fielded cleanly
angled across in the channel, opens the face to guide one behind square
short ball and again pulled dismissively through the leg side for a couple more
quicker and this bounces a touch more, Finch pulls and the ball deflects down on to the pitch
swats this away through backward square leg for another single
length ball, sprayed quite wide and Watson manages to toe end it into the covers for one more to the total
length ball on middle and leg, flicked around the corner to the man on the rope
shortish, outside off, sits in the crease and dabs one into the off side
Watson is in clover here, Rabada pitches full on off stump and is dispatched lazily back down the ground, bounced a yard short of the long-on boundary
on the stumps, worked away to leg for one more
length on middle and leg, 139kph but it stops in the pitch slightly, loops short of mid-on
well-directed short delivery, Finch rides the bounce and blocks short into the off side
pitched up full and straight, Watson whips it off his toes to midwicket
dug in very short and Watson elects to duck
touch full, on middle stump and clubbed to the mid-on fielder
short again, climbing rapidly through and this time Watson swings and misses

oh, he's gone, plugged a drive to mid-off! Warne has jinxed him... Watson was trying to hit the cover off every delivery and Parnell has been gifted a second wicket, didn't get the elevation he was looking for
good length on off stump, White opens the face and dabs in front of square but quickly nips back to his crease as the fielder homes in
or maybe not... short of a length and straying to leg from Rabada, Finch only needs to get some bat on it and the ball races to long leg for four
fuller and on the stumps, nudged through square on the leg side for a couple
length outside the line of off, tapped into the covers from the crease
slightly full and clubbed back, Rabada sticks out a hand but can't snag it, bounces short of Duminy at mid-off, whose throw is errant
short and Maxwell swings himself off his little feet, top-edging to backward point! Rabada has his first international wicket, Maxwell caught slogging high to the edge of the circle second ball
length delivery, stays back and runs one behind square on the off side
pushed back to the bowler
back of a length, punched standing tall to mid-off and they scamper one to bring the scores level
good length around the line of off, hits the outside half of the bat and rolls square
shorter, White shovels a loopy top-edged pull wide of square leg, it falls safely and that is that - Australia win by seven wickets with plenty to spare
